adr_address: 45 Rue du Dr Babinski, 75018 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Laid-back lodging offering simple rooms with complimentary Wi-Fi, plus a relaxed cafe.

formatted_address: 45 Rue du Dr Babinski, 75018 Paris, France
name: ibis budget Paris Porte de Montmartre

reviews.text:
I was really worried about my stay here due to the reviews but there wasn’t really anything to worry about. Yes the location isn’t the best, but the local people mind their own business as long as you mind your own!! They are just carrying on with their day and do not bother you if you do not bother them. We did not have any issues or did not feel unsafe at all.

The rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels were provided daily. The pillows were a little hard but you get what you pay for. If you’re going on a city holiday and only need the room to sleep, then this is perfect. But if you’re looking to use the hotel facilities throughout the day then that’s on you to pay for a hotel with more facilities. It’s a 2 star hotel, you can’t expect luxuries.

The staff were friendly and polite. We did not have any issues at all. If you’re going to complain about road noise etc, there’s nothing they can do about it. It’s on the customer to research the location before they book their stay.

Overall, we had a good stay and would stay again!

A busy hotel. The hotel is a little dated with the plastic pod bathroom.  But it was clean and tidy.  The area is a little rough. So I would go right rather than left out of the hotel.  But safe enough, just keep eye open. It's a good 10 minute walk to the metro. I found Garibaldi about the best.

The best: budget friendly hotel. Rooms are small but mattress are comfy and they come to clean every day. It's weird that the hand washing is outside the bathroom and in  the corner of the room. Got a triple room in which the bathroom was separate from the shower. Check in was easy and fast. Keys are by card and code.

The positives::
+ Very budget friendly, and not far from the metro station (10min walk) or bus stops (5-10 min walk).  Staff were not friendly, but were polite.
+ There is a very large flea market near the hotel, with lots of vendors of all sorts of things, and a few food options.

The negatives:
-The area around the Ibis was a rough neighborhood that is undergoing gentrification, so in a few years, the area is more likely to be a nicer experience.  I would NOT recommend this location for a solo female traveler for safety reasons.
-The Ibis staff informed us that they do not have Air Conditioning, but rather an 'Air Cooling System.'  However, despite the weather during our stay being mostly cloudy and rainy, with highs of 28-29C, inside the room got very hot.  Opening the window allowed some fresh air, but because it is so close to the freeway, it is unbearably LOUD and almost impossible to sleep due to not only the vehicular traffic, but also all of the people (possibly homeless) on the streets around the properly, who made noise at all hours of the day and night.  The staff were kind enough to lend us a fan for our room, but in the Parisian heat, I would NOT recommend this location unless you want to sleep in a sauna.
- The Ibis lobby was, at times, VERY full and disorganized with guests.  Directly outside of the lobby doors, were all sorts of debris and trash left by either the market or the homeless people in the neighborhood.  (It also smelled of urine, unfortunately.)
- There are no hand towels provided.  You must use your bath towel, and the sink for the room was located near the window, but the shower was located near the door.  It was very impractical not to have even one hand towel to share between two people (and the room had occupancy up to three people).
-There is only ONE wall plug, which made it inconvenient for two people to share the room.  There was another outlet near the sink, but it was not safe to charge electronics so close to the sink, and without anywhere safe to place your electronics (away from water) while charging.

Disappointing Stay – Not Ideal for Couples

We had low expectations given it’s a budget hotel, but even those weren’t met.

Pros:
•	Staff were polite and service was okay.
•	Good transport connections nearby.

Cons:
•	The hotel is quite rundown. Poor lighting in the room, very few sockets, and no AC despite it being advertised. We were given a fan instead, which wasn’t very helpful.
•	The toilet smelled bad and had no lid, and the sink was awkwardly placed across the room.
•	No extension cords available, which made using devices difficult.

Area:
•	The surrounding area felt unsafe, especially at night. There were many homeless people and we experienced some catcalling. As a couple, we didn’t feel comfortable walking around after dark.

Overall, we wouldn’t recommend Ibis—there are better budget options out there.
